## Professional skills

1. Experiment techniques

- Test stimuli: Be familiar with [PGF](https://ctan.org/pkg/pgf?lang=en) package in [LaTeX](https://www.latex-project.org), [ImageMagick](https://imagemagick.org) and its implementation in R [magick](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/magick/index.html), [OmniGraffle](https://www.omnigroup.com/omnigraffle/) (Proprietary), and [Pixelmator](https://www.pixelmator.com) (Proprietary) for image creating and editting; [praat](http://www.fon.hum.uva.nl/praat/), R packages [tuneR](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tuneR/index.html) and [seewave](https://cran.r-project.org/package=seewave), and [Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) (Proprietary) for audio editting and processing; [blender](https://www.blender.org) and [Autodesk Maya](https://www.autodesk.com/products/maya/overview) (Proprietary) for video and 3d modeling; [ffmpeg](https://ffmpeg.org) for audio and video format converting;
- Experiments building: Be familiar with [Psychopy](http://www.psychopy.org) under [Python](https://www.python.org), [Psychtoolbox](http://psychtoolbox.org) under [Matlab](https://www.mathworks.com/products/matlab.html), [E-prime](https://www.pstnet.com/eprime.cfm) (Proprietary), [Presentation](https://www.neurobs.com/presentation) (Proprietary), and [Experiment Builder](https://www.sr-research.com/experiment-builder/) (Proprietary);
- Eye-tracker: Advanced experience in using [Eyelink II/1000 plus](https://www.sr-research.com)  (Proprietary) for conducting experiments, [Experiment Builder](https://www.sr-research.com/experiment-builder/)  (Proprietary) for experiment building, and [Data Viewer](https://www.sr-research.com/data-viewer/)  (Proprietary) for data prepossing;
- E/MEG: In charge of establishing the first Child MEG lab in China; familiar with Yokogawa MEG system for equipment maintenance and MEG data acquisition, as well as [BESA](http://www.besa.de)  (Proprietary), [fieldtrip](http://www.fieldtriptoolbox.org) (Open source under Matlab), and [SPM12](https://github.com/neurodebian/spm12)  (Open source under Matlab) for data processing.

2. Data processing

- R: Besides base [R](https://www.r-project.org), be familiar with [data.table](http://r-datatable.com), [dplyr](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/dplyr/index.html), and [tidyr](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidyr/index.html) for data preprossing; [graphics](https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/graphics/html/00Index.html), [lattice](https://cran.r-project.org/package=lattice), and [ggplot2](http://ggplot2.tidyverse.org) for data visualization; [car](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/car/index.html), [lme4](https://github.com/lme4/lme4), and [gam](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/gam/index.html) for computational modeling; Create the R package [acqr](https://github.com/likanzhan/acqr) for teaching statistics and illustrating data visualization;
- Julia: Recently start to use [julia](https://julialang.org) for computational modeling, especially the [MixedModels](https://github.com/dmbates/MixedModels.jl) package, because of the speed limitations of R.

3. Other

- Markup languages: Be familiar with [LaTeX](https://www.latex-project.org), [markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/), [R markdown](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) (R package) , and [Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) for document preparing; [knitr](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/knitr/index.html) (R package) for dynamically integrating R code into a document; [Pandoc](https://pandoc.org) for markup format conversion;
- Personal website: Use [hugo](https://gohugo.io) under [go](https://golang.org) language and the R package [blogdown](https://github.com/rstudio/blogdown) to build my personal website [https://likan.info](https://likan.info).
